snippet: A Greenpeace India activist was stopped from boarding a flight to Britain in January, where she was scheduled to brief members of Parliament on the effect of mining on indigenous communities in central India.
abstract: Greenpeace India activist Priya Pillai files court petition against India's Ministry of Home Affairs after being blocked from boarding flight to Britain, where she was set to talk with Parliament members about effects of mining on central India's indigenous communities; case highlights fears that India's government may be targeting nongovernmental organizations it perceives to be hurting country's economic growth.
lead_paragraph: A Greenpeace India activist was stopped from boarding a flight to Britain in January, where she was scheduled to brief members of Parliament on the effect of mining on indigenous communities in central India.

headline.main: India Blocked an Activist From Traveling to Britain
